lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The two countries, buffeted by unfavourable external factors in the past few years, were forced to curb aggregate domestic consumption demands last year to avoid severe balance of payments pressures and to resort to extensive commercial borrowings.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The Singapore economic revival was hampered by its own adjustment measures especially its two-year wage freeze enforced last April, a glut of its property market and depressed conditions in its ASEAN neighbours which hurt Singapore because they take about a quarter of its total exports.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: It said the most favourable factor benefiting the three was the realignment of key currencies, especially the appreciation of the yen, which has resulted in the increased competitiveness of their exports against those from Japan.

lst.name: sentence
